project.teaser: Among the available freshwater resources, groundwater (GW) plays a key role in providing water supplies and livelihoods to respond the pronounced water scarcity. GW pollution by chemicals (organic and inorganic) and biological agents (viruses and bacteria) originating from...
project.objective: Among the available freshwater resources, groundwater (GW) plays a key role in providing water supplies and livelihoods to respond the pronounced water scarcity. GW pollution by chemicals (organic and inorganic) and biological agents (viruses and bacteria) originating from human activities is a widespread worldwide problem. The scientific and technological goals of the UPWATER project are (1) to provide scientific knowledge on identification, occurrence and fate of pollutants in the GW with cost-efficient sampling methods based on passive samplers for chemicals and pathogens; (2) to develop sources apportionment methods to identify and quantify the pollution sources, including Compound Specific Isotopic Analysis (CSIA) and (3) to validate and assess the performance of bio-based engineered natural treatment systems designed as mitigation solutions. The monitoring and mitigation solutions will be validated in 3 case studies (DK, GR and ES), representing different EU climate conditions and a combination of rural, industrial and urban pollution sources. The existing hydrogeological models will be updated with innovative water quality modelling tools, allowing the simulation of decision-making scenarios under multiple stressors and climate change projections. The scenarios will also include the expected impacts of scaling-up the mitigation solutions and the adoption of other non-technological preventive measures devoted to minimise the release of chemicals at source (chemicals regulation, taxation, consumption campaigns, public procurement, etc). The exploitation of specific UPWATER results will lead to expected mid-term outcomes including among others: updating the EU chemical priority lists, scaling-up the pilot bio-based solutions to demonstration scale, the adoption of some preventive measures in the case studies and the close-to-market development of the passive sampling devices.
project.title: Understanding groundwater Pollution to protect and enhance WATERquality

result.title: Ethics, gender and innovation
result.description: The reports is related the DMP (D1.2) and includes section about ethics, gender and innovation aspects. Related Tasks outcome: T1.3 Ethics, gender, innovation and data management plan.

result.title: Assessing novel NBS mitigation technologies
result.description: Assess novel bio-based treatment strategies (floating wetlands and ZVI-bioelectrochemical wetlands) at laboratory scale to mitigate GW pollution. Related tasks outcome: T2.1 Bio-based mitigation measures and T2.2 Explore a biofilm approach for pollutant mitigation at derelict dumpsites.

result.title: Initial Policy brief at local/regional and EU levels
result.description: Initial Policy brief at local/regional and EU levels to document a first version of the practical policy recommendations along with suggestions for improving the supporting governance frameworks at local/ regional/EU levels for more effective protection of GW quality. Related Tasks outcome: T6.4 Recommendations on policy and governance at local, regional and EU levels.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - UPWATER (Understanding groundwater Pollution to protect and enhance WATERquality)
result.teaser: Groundwater (GW) is an important resource for freshwater and plays a key role in providing water supplies and livelihoods to respond to drought episodes. According to the European Environmental Agency, 26% of the European Union's GW bodies have poor chemical quality. Once the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on environmental risk assessment - initial
result.description: Initial report on environmental risk assessment to determine which pollutants present the greatest risk in each site, to define which risk mitigation measures are needed, and to assess the potential changes in exposure routes necessary to meet the targeted ecological environmental protection goals. Related Tasks outcome: T5.2 Environmental risk assessment.

result.title: User Guide for the UPWATER Cloud Ecosystem
result.description: User Guide for the UPWATER Cloud Ecosystem, including the Data Context system, where data are stored and made available for analysis and exploitation will be hosted in a server or in a cloud service and will be collecting data generated by Sensors or other data sources. Related Tasks outcome: T3.3 UPWATER Cloud Ecosystem.

result.title: Monitoring plan
result.description: Defines the monitoring strategy to determine the pollution sources and degradation of contaminants in GW in the three CS (WP4) and evaluating the performance of the mitigation nature-based solutions (WP5). Related tasks outcome: T2.5 Monitoring plan.

result.title: Initial report on dissemination, communication and exploitation activities
result.description: Initial report on communication and dissemination of the projects results across the different stakeholders, and also including information related website and social media.Related Tasks outcome: T7.3 Website and social media channels and T7.4 Dissemination, communication and exploitation activities.

result.title: Data Management Plan-Midterm
result.description: Data Management Plan -Midterm- to assess the progres of the DMP and also of the data policy related the research activities within UPWATER, in order that the data gathered or produced by the partners are made available to the rest of the consortium. Related Tasks outcome: T3.1 Data Policy Plan.

result.title: Project Management Manual
result.description: Project Management Manual will be prepared and distributed among the partners and will compile information on project structure, administrative procedures, meetings schedule, internal quality control forms, etc. Related Tasks outcome: T1.1 Setting up management structure and T1.2 Administrative & financial management, EC relations and Consortium technical coordination.

result.title: Waterborne viruses in urban groundwater environments
Data Management Plan-initial
result.description: Initial Data Management Plan including data policy. The DMP described the data generated and /or collected during the project life and give details about how it will be managed. Additionally, to warrant continuity to the research activities within UPWATER, it is essential that data gathered or produced by the partners are made available as soon as possible to the rest of the consortium. Related Tasks outcome: T3.1 Data Policy Plan.

result.title: UPWATER Assessment Framework
result.description: UPWATER Assessment Framework to enable complex decision-making by prioritizing constellations of solutions to prevent and mitigate GW pollution will be developed. Related Tasks outcome: T5.1 Assessment framework for analyzing pollution pathways, and assessing related risks and impacts of mitigation measures.

result.title: Stakeholder engagement implementation plan
result.description: Stakeholder engagement implementation plan, including a set-up, timing and scope of stakeholder engagement and best non-technological preventive practices characterisation will be defined. Related Tasks outcome: T6.1 Stakeholders engagement and policies and best practices analysis.

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
